basics.name: Brendan Cazier
basics.label: Mechanical Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a mechanical engineer by education, having spent all of my early career working with  physical problems associated with aircraft maintenance and reliability. Originally I used coding as a hobby and to try to automate various tasks either at work or at home, but I'm now looking to turn that into my profession. I have worked on both long-term, large-scope, campains, as well as high urgency, triage-esque, projects. I enjoy problem solving, and have worked to provide solutions while conscious of labor difficulties, costs, reliability and regulatory requirements, and more.

work.summary: Extended Internship Program in Narrowbody Systems Project Engineering
highlights: Focused primarily on Boeing B737-NG and MD80 Fleets
Revised technical documentation, ensuring compliance to FAA, CFR, and OEM regulations.
Designed and prototyped a drop-in air filtration system for the B737-NG and B757, and began fleet implementation
Benchmarked fleetwide reliability improvements to minimize in-service cancellations and in-flight issues
Developed Maintenance procedures for all fleets, specifically focused on Nitrogen Generation System, Landing Gear, and Fuel Management systems.

work.company: SWECO - MI SWACO, A Schlumberger Company
work.summary: SWECO is an American oilfield services manufacturer of industrial filtration devices for seperating solids and fluids
highlights: Summer Internship, modelling hydraulic components for shaker devices in Solidworks
Replaced a catalog of individual models with parametrically-generated designs allowing for on-the-fly creation of new and customized parts
Worked alongside technicians to create an instrument cabinet system to store manifold prototypes
Developed, and prototyped, a training program for combining the individual components to full oilfield assemblies to demonstrate sales capabilities
